p.s: In the given scene the director highlights the relationship between Chris and Starr and Chris' importance in Starr's life.
In the course of the scene, the viewer can see that there are certain problems in their relationship for example that Chris thinks, that Starr is excluding him from her life.
The scene starts with a medium-eye-level-shot which shows Chris walking down the hallway in slow-motion.
The camera follows him as he greatsgreets everybody.
Slow and melancholic music is played in the background and Starr tells the viewer that she really likes Chris.
With that, he is presented as the cool, popular guy that takes everyhing easy.
Next, there is a close up on Chris' shoes and Starr says that she has the same and that Chris looks very good with them.
The slow-motion and the music let the viewer think that everything in their relationship is perfect and they really love each other.
An eye-level-close-up on Starr shows how Chris gives her his headphones.
This foreshadows her positive reaction to the music.
She then takes them off, telling Chris that she doesn't like it and their conversation gets serious.
They are shown in medium-over-the-shoulder and reversed-angle-shots to highlight their facial expressions and their reactions to each other.
Between these shots there are a few close-ups on their faces to show the importance of their conversation.
When Chris walked down the hallway, everything seemd perfect and okay but then the slow music stops and during their conversation their relationship starts to look fragile.
Chris thinks that their relationship is too slow because they know each other for six months.
He also thinks that Starr wants to exclude him from her life because she hasn't introduced him to her parents jetyet.
This shows that he thinks about their relationship and that it is serious to him.
On the other hand, Starr thinks that Chris just wants to sleep with her and that he isn't interested into having a real relationship.
Because the tension between them gets more and more, Chris asks her about her opinion about his music.
He feels that their conversation won't come to a solution so he changes the subject.
He says that he wants to proofprove that his music is good so he turns the volume up and starts dancing in the hallway.
While dancing, Chris is shown in a full shot and then is slow-motion while hte camera zooms in.
This shows again that they have a really good relationship if they forget their problems.
The scene is framed from slow-motion shots, which highlights the special relationship and the conflict of them.
At the beginning and at the end of the scene, Starr doesn't speak directly, you can just hear her voice.
This underlines her thoughts about Chris and that she does not want to share them with him.
She does not want to admit to him that she is not angry anymore.
When she talks to him, the music stops playing and the viewer can only hear her talking so the viewer is excluded from her thoughts.
With that, the director want'swants the viewer to see Chris with Starr's eyes.
Starr's split opinion about Chris is underlined and her trust issues that she has about everybody in her school.
In conclusion you can say that Chris is presented as a cool, popular boy who wants to be included in the life of his girlfriend.
But the relationship with Starr is not as perfect as it seems because Starr does not trust Chris completely and does not want to share too much of her personality with him.
